title: Constructivist-Based Mathematics Instructional Design: Philosophical Approach and Practical Application

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and foundational experience in professional fields
context.additional_context: Need for constructivist interaction design optimized for smartphone-based learning environments.

learning_goals: Learners will explain the historical and philosophical foundations of constructivist learning theory and apply them to mathematics education.
Learners will design mathematical models using a constructivist approach to solve real-world workplace problems (medical/legal/technical) via smartphones.
Learners will improve mathematical problem-solving processes by establishing a peer feedback system based on Piaget’s and Vygotsky’s theories.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
